info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:03PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Siskiyou County through 530 PM PDT... At 502 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Hebron, or 32 miles east of Yreka, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Hebron, Macdoel, Bray and Juanita Lake Campground. This includes US 97 in California between mile markers 23 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
